p: As shown in Table 2 , for about 2/3rd of the participants an idea of someone being there to absolve their worries regarding the COVID-19 pandemic was welcoming. A total of 75 % agreed on the necessity of mental healthcare for individuals who panic amid the pandemic situation. More than 80 % of participants felt the need for the professional help from mental health experts to deal with emotional issues and other psychological issues during this pandemic.
